The axis of PC1 exhibited contributions from bases that changed once, whereas PC2 was characterized by bases that changed back and forth (Fig. S4A). This oscillation might have been caused by sequential random walk mutation
6 . The random walk model was also supported by the rapid attenuation of the contributions and the accordance with the tangent rule (Fig. S4)
6 . However, a constant pattern of oscillation did not appear in lower-level PCs, suggesting that the changes were not fully random; rather, they seemed to obey some unidentified rules.
